headline: Jensen Huang Says Tesla FSD Is 'State-Of-The-Art,' Explains How Nvidia's Alpamayo Is Different
summary: Nvidia Corp (NASDAQ:NVDA) CEO Jensen Huang has hailed the progress made by Tesla Inc.'s (NASDAQ:TSLA) Full Self-Driving (FSD) system, saying that the Elon Musk-led EV giant’s approach was “hard to criticize.” FSD Is State-Of-The-Art, Says Jensen Huang Huang, in an interview with Bloomberg's Ed Ludlow on Tuesday, was asked about the differences between Nvidia's approach to self-driving in comparison with Tesla's FSD. headline: Corero Network Security Appoints Michelle Ragusa-McBain as Vice President of Channel Sales
summary: Corero Network Security (AIM: CNS) (OTCQX: DDOSF), a recognized leader in DDoS protection and champion of adaptive, real-time service availability, today announced the appointment of Michelle Ragusa-McBain as Global Channel Chief, Vice President of Channel Sales. Ragusa-McBain will lead Corero's global channel strategy, accelerating partner-led growth and expanding the company's go-to-market ecosystem worldwide.

raw.headline: Corero Network Security Appoints Michelle Ragusa-McBain as Vice President of Channel Sales

Ragusa-McBain will lead Corero's global channel strategy, accelerating partner-led growth and expanding the company's go-to-market ecosystem worldwide.

headline: Is It Time To Reassess Cisco Systems (CSCO) After Its Recent Share Price Pullback
summary: If you are wondering whether Cisco Systems at around US$74.72 still offers value after its strong run, you are not alone. The stock is down 3.0% over the last week and 5.2% over the last month, while returns sit at a 1.7% decline year to date, 29.3% over 1 year, 65.3% over 3 years, and 90.4% over 5 years. Recent headlines around Cisco have focused on its position as a major networking and security player and how that fits into long term demand for connectivity and cloud infrastructure...

headline: Cisco’s 25-Year Journey Back to Its Dot-Com Peak Offers a Cautionary Tech Lesson
summary: Douglas and Lee discussed Cisco’s return to its dot-com highs after 25 years, using it as a warning about valuation excess and long-term patience in technology investing.
